Ash stood at the other side of the tunnel, arms crossed, tapping his right foot on the ground. "Man, what's taking Tai so long?" he said to himself, "She did come in, right?" Ash got on his knees, peering into the tunnel he crawled through and couldn't see any light on the other side. Ash raised an eyebrow and wondered, "The tunnel wasn't that long, I should be able to see some light." he frowned and called out, "Tai? Tai!?" "Ash..." he heard Tai-Lee's distant call for help and cried out, "Tai!" then began to crawl back to her.

Tai-Lee sniffled, thinking Ash forgot about her, until she heard, "Tai!" Tai-Lee's face shot up and called back. "Ash!?" "Don't worry, I'm coming for ya!" he replied, making his way toward Tai-Lee. After a few seconds, Ash made it to Tai-Lee's upper half and apologized with a frown, "Tai. I'm so, so sorry for going ahead without you. I didn't think you would get stuck. Tai-Lee shook her head and smiled, "It's okay. At least you came back."

"Of course I was going to come back. I mean, this is probably the only exit." Ash joked, causing her to giggle, "You jerk. So... could you help me in?" Ash nodded and gave her a rope and began to crawl back out to the other side, since it would be easier to pull standing than it would laying down.

Tai-Lee waited for a minute, until she felt a sharp tug on the rope she was holding. Ash began pulling, immediately feeling the resistance Tai-Lee's huge rear was making, but he continued to pull until...
15222.title: Waiting...

152221.content:
It was very slow, but Tai-Lee was moving. And the more progress she made, the slower and harder it was to move her. It was when she got to the widest part of her rear where she stopped moving.

Ash continued to pull for a few minutes and growled, "I'm not exploring without you Tai! So... just... MOVE!" he roared, pulling his hardest.
152221.title: Give it all you got!

choices: They abandonned the remains and get back to the cave.
153.content:
-Remember when we were kids? asked Ash.
-Yeah. Why? answered Tai-Lee intrigued.
-Well, look. mysteriously said Ash.
-Our old hideout! exclaimed herself Tai-Lee.
Inside, dust... And memories, the stick of power! This was the center of many of their adventures as kids.
Ashram Likban! they used to say, the old formula to unlock the power of imagination.
i wonder if...
153.title: Their old hideout!
